questions.question: Which of the following is a requirement for a slab intended to serve as the compression flange of a T-beam or L-beam?

answers.a: The slab should be detached from the web
answers.b: The slab must be cast together with the web or securely bonded to it
answers.c: The slab should have minimal reinforcement
answers.d: The slab must have a separate support system

questions.question: When the primary reinforcement of the slab runs parallel to the beam in a T-beam or L-beam configuration, what percentage of additional transverse reinforcement is typically required?
In a flanged beam system where a reinforced concrete slab sits atop a reinforced concrete beam, which component primarily bears compression forces?
In which part of the continuous T or L beams do slabs primarily experience tension forces?

In Case 3 of T beam analysis, where the neutral axis lies beneath the flange and the strain at the bottom of the slab remains below 0.002, what condition leads to non-linear stress distribution within the flange?
In an inverted T-beam, which is true?

answers.a: Web at bottom, flange at top
answers.b: Web at top, flange at bottom
